alert.note: Alert for Northampton (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 6:33PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of north central Northampton, southeastern Greensville, southwestern Isle of Wight and southern Southampton Counties and the City of Franklin through 715 PM EDT... At 632 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Franklin to near Seaboard. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Franklin, Carrsville, Hunterdale and Sedley around 640 PM EDT. Windsor around 710 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Collosse, Lees Mill, Margarettsville, Handsom, Walters, Burdette, Branchville, Bryants Corner, Shiloh and Story. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for northeastern North Carolina...and southeastern Virginia.
